intro: Lepisanthes balansana, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often variegated. Its flowers, which come in shades of white, purple, and pink, are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Lepisanthes balansana is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
